segments.speaker: Host

segments.text: Look at your mother, look at your father, who may do much for you and never get seen.
segments.speaker: Host

segments.text: See them, be grateful they're in your life.
segments.speaker: Host

segments.text: Some people have complicated family lives.
segments.speaker: Host

segments.text: Doesn't matter.
segments.speaker: Host

segments.text: Be grateful, glad that you're alive.
segments.speaker: Host

segments.text: That's it.
segments.speaker: Host

segments.text: Stop looking at other people as idols.
segments.speaker: Host

segments.text: You may find some right there in your family.
segments.speaker: Host

segments.text: Thank you so much, Smriti Ji.
segments.speaker: Guest

segments.text: I was really excited to have this conversation with you.
segments.speaker: Guest

segments.text: And I feel that everyone at home would have really benefited from learning about real experiences working on the ground, some valuable takeaways, I think, of anybody who has aspirations to join public service and to perhaps give back to their country.
segments.speaker: Guest

segments.text: Leadership is actually built over years of hard work.
segments.speaker: Guest

segments.text: It takes continuous learning.
segments.speaker: Guest

segments.text: And it's very important to, as you said, stay connected to your purpose and to have that sort of clarity.
segments.speaker: Guest

segments.text: I hope today's episode leaves you at home as inspired as I am.
segments.speaker: Guest

segments.text: I do want to thank you for watching another episode of All About Her.
segments.speaker: Guest

segments.text: Please don't forget to like, share and subscribe and we will see you soon with another remarkable story.
segments.speaker: Guest

segments.text: Until next time, stay informed, stay healthy and we'll see you soon.
segments.speaker: Guest
